result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monjaye R Nicholson

records.addlTxt: Order Appointing Counsel, signed and filed.

Defendant Monjaye R Nicholson in court.  Attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant requests a court appointed attorney.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  
Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  
The court appointed Attorney Michael Plaisted to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. 
The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $25.00 per month beginning on 12/1/2022 and then the 1st of each month there after.  
Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment. 
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Monjaye R Nicholson in court.  Student Intern Madeline Witte under the supervision of Attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 13. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/7/22 @ 2p
